📢【Zero Rise】bekommt eine Anime-Adaption! ✨️

📅 Geplanter Start 》TBA
✨ Genre 》Sports, Drama, Action
🎬 Studio 》Nichicaline

Mehr Details im Bildtext. Trailer unter dem Beitrag.

#ZeroRise #Bushiroad #AnimeNews #OriginalAnime #Anime

images.alt:
Auf dem Event »Bushiroad New Year Announcements 2026« wurde bekannt gegeben, dass Bushiroads Crossmedia-Franchise ein neues Projekt mit dem Titel Zero Rise erhält. Zur Ankündigung wurden ein Visual sowie ein Teaser Trailer und ein Charakter Trailer veröffentlicht. Außerdem wurden die Mitwirkenden an der Produktion und der japanische Sprechercast offiziell vorgestellt. Ein genauer Starttermin steht bislang noch nicht fest.

Zero Rise entsteht nach einer Originalidee von Bushiroad. Storyboard, Regie und die CG Direktion übernimmt Daichi Omori, bekannt durch das CG Video zu Peaky P key Wish You Luck. Als Musikkomponist ist Yusa Higuchi beteiligt. Für den Ton ist Satoshi Motoyama als Sound Director an Bord, den viele aus Insomniacs After School kennen. Die Gesamtleitung der Animation liegt bei Hiroaki Matsuura, der durch Projekte wie Arpeggio of Blue Steel und Bubuki Buranki bekannt ist. Produziert wird die Animation bei Nichicaline.

🎙️ Charaktere & Cast (Japanisch)
UNFIXX
»Madoka Kurogare« von Hiroki Sasamori
»Hagane Amadate (Date)« von Tomoya Fukui
»Tsukasa Marindo (Merlin)« von Kai Otomo
KINGS+HOOT

BLACKSPOT

»UNKNOWN A« von Shota Takiyama (Suit Actor)
»UNKNOWN B« von Yushi (Suit Actor)

»Hayato Jigen« von Yuki Kimisawa

📜 Beschreibung 》
ZERO RISE folgt jungen Athleten, die wegen früherer Fehler und harter Lebensumstände ihren Platz im Basketball verloren haben. In einer Welt, in der Arm und Reich weit auseinanderklaffen, kämpfen sie in der gnadenlosen Underground League „Zero Rise“ um Wiedergutmachung und eine neue Zukunft. Zwischen Talent, Moral und Überleben stellt sich am Ende nur eine Frage: bekommen sie ihre zweite Chance oder zerbricht sie dieses System.

external.description: OpenAI, Eylül 2026'da tanıtması beklenen yeni kulaklığı ile Apple, Samsung, Sony, Xiaomi ve JBL gibi üreticilere rakip olmaya hazırlanıyor. Kod adı "Sweetpea" olan cihaz, Apple'ın efsane tasarımcısı Jony Ive'ın liderliğindeki bir ekip tarafından geliştiriliyor ve ChatGPT entegrasyonu ile dikkat çekmesi bekleniyor. OpenAI'ın Yeni Kulaklığı iPhone'u Yapay Zeka ile Yönetecek ChatGPT'yi sadece bir araçla sınırlamak istemeyen OpenAI, bu teknolojiyi hayatımızın her noktasına entegre etmek için çalışmalarını sürdürüyor.

external.description: 15 yaş altındaki kişilerin sosyal medya kullanımını yasaklayacak düzenlemeyi de içeren torba yasa teklifinin ayın sonuna doğru meclise sunulması planlanıyor. Bu gelişmeden sonra şimdi de yeni bir düzenleme için adım atıldı. Bu doğrultuda yapay zeka kullanımına da yaş kısıtlaması getirilmesi bekleniyor. Yapay Zeka İçin Yaş Kısıtlaması Üzerinde Çalışılıyor Türkiye Gazetesi'nin haberine göre Siber Güvenlik Başkanlığı bünyesindeki Yapay Zeka Genel Müdürlüğü ve Adalet Bakanlığının koordinasyonunda yürütülen çalışma kapsamında 15 yaş altındaki kişilerin yapay zeka kullanımının sınırlandırılması planlanıyor.

record.text:
NDSS 2025 – Mens Sana In Corpore Sano: Sound Firmware Corpora For Vulnerability Research

This paper, presented at the NDSS Symposium, focuses on the creation of sound firmware corpora for vulnerability research. The authors highlight the difficulties in building these corpora, pr…
#hackernews #news

external.description: This paper, presented at the NDSS Symposium, focuses on the creation of sound firmware corpora for vulnerability research. The authors highlight the difficulties in building these corpora, primarily due to complexities in acquiring data and copyright restrictions.  The unknown contents of firmware images and the need for high-quality samples also pose significant challenges. Sharing data is problematic and papers must carefully document each step for replicability. Imperfect documentation can jeopardize the verifiability and representativeness of research findings.  The paper analyzes the impact of these challenges on firmware corpus creation, offering practical guidelines for researchers. These guidelines aim to improve the replicability and representativeness of future research, leading to improved scientific soundness. The authors analyze 44 top-tier papers, discovering methodological issues in corpus creation. They demonstrate the value of their guidelines by uncovering documentation weaknesses.  A new Linux firmware corpus, LFwC, is built to showcase the feasibility of the guidelines.  LFwC includes rich metadata promoting replicability and verified unpacking, deduplication, and content identification. This work aims to enhance the application and advancement of security technologies within the Internet community.
external.title: NDSS 2025 – Mens Sana In Corpore Sano: Sound Firmware Corpora For Vulnerability Research

record.text: The majority of internal "listening to patients" is frankly rubbish and left to people without any power to be heard. External bodies like HealthWatch add the rigour that is needed in a system that is generally so averse to criticism.

There's a reason why important things in the NHS are often leaked before the digital ink is dry, it's because the official dissent channels are firmly closed.

images.alt:
TÉMOIGNAGE
#ViolGynécologique
Je suis victime d'une pénétration vaginale sans mon consentement, sans information et alors que je n'ai jamais eu de rapports pénétratifs. Et pourtant, je ne ressens que de la culpabilité. La culpabilité d'être bizarre. La culpabilité d'être différente des autres. La culpabilité de ne pas avoir eu de sexualité pénétrative à 20 ans. C'est vrai que je sais peu de chose sur le préservatif, sur ce qu'est un rapport sexuel avec pénétration. Je suis une jeune femme qui n'a pas compris ce qu'est la sexualité ! A l'issue de l'examen, la gynécologue conclue: « Vous avez un utérus de la taille d'un carambar, de la taille d'un utérus de petite fille ! ».
Cette conclusion donnée en fin de rendez-vous ne s'accompagne d'aucune explication sur le lien avec mon motif de consultation.
2021, CABINET PRIVE, VITRÉ (35)

TÉMOIGNAGE
#ViolGynécologique
Avec du recul, cela me paraît étrange. Elle ne tient pas compte de mon vécu et des changements qui m'ont amenée à consulter. Pourquoi n'ai-je pas déjà eu cette conclusion lors des premiers examens gynécologiques ?
Je suis retournée voir cette gynécologue, accompagnée de ma mère pour me soutenir dans mon besoin d'explications.
Elle a bien vu que les différentes remarques de la gynécologue m'avaient blessée. Nous avons du insister pour qu'elle puisse m'accompagner dans le cabinet. La gynécologue ne voulait pas la laisser entrer, parce que j'étais majeure. Or la présence d'une accompagnante est un droit pour chaque patiente. Ce médecin semble l'ignorer.
2021, CABINET PRIVÉ, VITRÉ (35)
5/8

TÉMOIGNAGE
#ViolGynécologique
Je change, bien sûr, de gynécologue. J'évoque parfois cet événement comme si jétais passée à autre chose. Mais je suis vite rattrapée par le traumatisme que je n'ai pas identifié.
Quelques temps plus tard, je suis en couple. Mon copain est au courant de cette histoire et sait donc qu'il faut prendre notre temps pour la sexualité. Il est plutôt à l'écoute et compréhensif mais rapidement, il me fait comprendre qu'il veut plus, mais qu'il ne faut pas que je me mette la pression. Or, très fragile, et ne connaissant pas bien mon corps, j'accepte un rapport pénétratif. Je lui ai rapidement demandé d'arrêter la pénétration trop douloureuse. Mais surtout, je me suis subitement revue sur la table d'examen, chez la gynécologue, quand elle m'imposait l'échographie
endovaginale.
2021, CABINET PRIVÉ, VITRÉ (35)

TÉMOIGNAGE
#ViolGynécologique
C'est grâce à une thérapie, grâce au soutien de mes amies et grâce à la rencontre de soignants respectueux, à l'écoute et sensibilisés à ce sujet, que j'ai compris que mon corps avait gardé des traces de cet acte violent et de ces paroles blessantes. J'ai pu mettre des mots sur ce que j'avais subi dans ce cabinet médical. J'ai été victime d'un viol par surprise. Il m'a fallu du temps pour l'admettre, pour avoir la force de me battre et aller de l'avant.
Pour conclure, cette histoire m'a finalement permis de comprendre que mon âge me rendait ignorante sur la raison de mes problèmes de santé, ignorante des mots utilisés par les soignantes, ignorante du déroulement des examens. En tant que patiente, je devais être écoutée, je devais recevoir des explications compréhensibles sur les examens que je devais subir, je devais pouvoir poser des questions sans avoir l'impression de déranger, je devais être respectée dans mes choix de vie.
2021, CABINET PRIVÉ, VITRÉ (35)

J'AI PU METTRE DES MOTS SUR CE QUE J'AVAIS SUBI DANS CE CABINET MÉDICAL. J'AI ÉTÉ VICTIME D'UN VIOL PAR SURPRISE.
IL M'A FALLU DU TEMPS POUR L'ADMETTRE, POUR AVOIR LA FORCE DE ME BATTRE ET ALLER DE L'AVANT.
2021, CABINET PRIVÉ, VITRÉ (35)

TÉMOIGNAGE
#ViolGynécologique
J'ai un suivi gynécologique depuis mes 15 ans, pour la prise en charge d'une pathologie. J'ai alors subi de nombreux examens assez traumatisants quand ils viennent questionner votre rapport au corps qui est en plein changement. En raison d'un déménagement, je ne peux garder la gynécologue qui avait posé ce diagnostic, et avec qui je suis en confiance et respectée.
Avec la nouvelle gynécologue, tout change.
Afin d'effectuer un bilan, une échographie est programmée.
J'ai un très mauvais souvenir de ma première échographie, pour laquelle jai dũ boire encore et encore car selon l'échographiste, je n'avais pas la vessie assez pleine. Alors cette fois-ci, je bois des quantités d'eau au cours de la journée sans aller aux toilettes.
2021, CABINET PRIVÉ, VITRÉ (35)
Stop VoGr
1/8

TÉMOIGNAGE
#ViolGynécologique
Mon rendez-vous, programmé après mon après-midi de travail, est une véritable séance de torture car ma vessie est pleine à craquer. Comme à mon habitude, j'ai suivi toutes les consignes données par la gynécologue. Celle-ci commence l'échographie. Puis, au bout de quelques minutes, elle se demande pourquoi elle ne voit pas mes ovaires. Sûre d'elle, elle me dit alors que ma vessie est trop pleine. Là, je pense à l'après-midi d'enfer que je me suis imposé en vu de cet examen. Cependant, jobéis et vais vider ma vessie, tant bien que mal car m'être retenue si longtemps et subir l'agacement de la praticienne ne m'aident pas. De retour dans la salle d'examen, réinstallée sur la table, les jambes en l'air, écartées, je subis un choc total : sans m'en informer, sans me demander mon consentement, la gynécologue force la pénétration de mon vagin.
2021, CABINET PRIVÉ, VITRÉ (35)

TÉMOIGNAGE
#ViolGynécologique
Or, je me suis contractée, ce qui l'empêche d'introduire cet objet, la sonde pour une échographie endovaginale.
Je me souviens d'avoir été là, sans vraiment y être. Je n'ose rien dire, je ne sais pas ce qu'elle essaye de faire. Je suis paralysée ! La gynécologue ne perçoit pas du tout mon malaise et me demande brutalement : « Avez-vous déjà eu des rapports? ». Je lui réponds avec empressement que non. Sa réaction me laisse sans voix alors que j'ai les larmes aux yeux : « C'est étonnant à votre âge ! ». Je n'ai que 20 ans. Je ne pensais pas être jugée sur mes choix de vie par une gynécologue. Mon esprit se détache totalement de mon corps et sa remarque tourne en boucle dans ma tête.
2021, CABINET PRIVÉ, VITRÉ (35)
3/8

Attackers’ AI Advantage: Old Playbooks, New Scale in 2025

The cybersecurity landscape of 2025, while often painted with a broad brush of futuristic threats, reveals a stark reality: the most effective attacks are surprisingly familiar. At AllSafeUs Research Labs, our analysis of recent trends…

external.description: The cybersecurity landscape of 2025, while often painted with a broad brush of futuristic threats, reveals a stark reality: the most effective attacks are surprisingly familiar. At AllSafeUs Research Labs, our analysis of recent trends indicates that while the industry frets over nascent "AI-powered attacks" and complex "quantum-resistant encryption" challenges, attackers have instead opted for a more pragmatic approach. They are not inventing entirely new attack vectors; rather, they are leveraging advanced artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) capabilities to optimize and scale existing, well-understood vulnerabilities.
external.title: Attackers’ AI Advantage: Old Playbooks, New Scale in 2025

external.description: The cybersecurity landscape of 2025, while often painted with a broad brush of futuristic threats, reveals a stark reality: the most effective attacks are surprisingly familiar. At AllSafeUs Research Labs, our analysis of recent trends indicates that while the industry frets over nascent "AI-powered attacks" and complex "quantum-resistant encryption" challenges, attackers have instead opted for a more pragmatic approach. They are not inventing entirely new attack vectors; rather, they are leveraging advanced artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) capabilities to optimize and scale existing, well-understood vulnerabilities.
external.title: Attackers’ AI Advantage: Old Playbooks, New Scale in 2025

Project Nightfall: Assessing the Geopolitical and Technical Ramifications of Britain’s Rapid Missile Development

At AllSafeUs Research Labs, we continuously monitor global defense innovations and their far-reaching implications for national and international security. The recent announcement…

external.description: At AllSafeUs Research Labs, we continuously monitor global defense innovations and their far-reaching implications for national and international security. The recent announcement regarding Britain's 'Project Nightfall'—an initiative to rapidly develop a new ground-launched ballistic missile—represents a pivotal moment, signaling a significant shift in defense procurement strategies and geopolitical dynamics. This endeavor, primarily aimed at bolstering Ukraine's long-range strike capabilities against Russia, also holds the potential to reshape the United Kingdom's own defense posture.
external.title: Project Nightfall: Assessing the Geopolitical and Technical Ramifications of Britain’s Rapid Missile Development

The landscape of enterprise Artificial Intelligence (AI) security has reached a critical inflection point, heralded by the unveiling of Nvidia's Vera Rubin NVL72 platform at CES 2026. This isn't merely…

external.description: The landscape of enterprise Artificial Intelligence (AI) security has reached a critical inflection point, heralded by the unveiling of Nvidia's Vera Rubin NVL72 platform at CES 2026. This isn't merely another hardware upgrade; it represents a fundamental paradigm shift, moving the industry from an era of contractual trust to one of verifiable cryptographic assurance. For organizations heavily invested in frontier AI development, the implications are profound, especially in an environment increasingly threatened by sophisticated, machine-speed adversaries.

images.alt:
Screenshot of Claude Code terminal interface showing a migration progress checklist
The terminal displays a dark-themed interface with two tabs labeled "1: fg" and "2: ~" at the top. The main content shows a detailed task list for what appears to be a Rust codebase migration project.
The upper portion (lines 47-54) shows completed tasks highlighted in green, including items like "PrivateIpStackCreate enum," "InstanceNetworkInterfaceCreate with ip_config," and creating dual_stack_nics files for floating_ip.rs and probe.rs.
Below that, lines 43-54 show another set of completed tasks (marked with [x]) in a green-highlighted block, detailing work on dual_stack_nics/instance.rs including IpAssignment<T> enum, type aliases, and various struct implementations.
The middle section shows "Phase 4: Add Types to silo_project_ip_version_and_pool_type" with a file being written containing Mozilla Public License headers and module documentation about adding ip_version and pool_type fields to SiloIpPool responses.
At the bottom, a "Cerebrating..." status bar shows the AI is thinking (1m 30s elapsed, 5.7k tokens). Below this is a checklist of remaining tasks including completing dual_stack_nics/instance.rs, creating version module files, updating latest.rs, resolving conflicts, and running cargo checks.
The footer shows "accept edits on (shift+tab to cycle)" indicating pending code changes awaiting user approval.

record.text:
More customers are asking AI before they Google.

“Who should I buy from?”
“Which service is best for me?”

I’ve written a practical guide for small businesses and online retailers on how to show up in AI search

👉 https://www.pollinger.ai/blog/how-to-make-your-small-business-show-up-in-ai-search

external.description:
If you have ever felt invisible online, here is the new version of that problem.

It is no longer just “can people find my website”. It is “can an AI understand what I sell, trust it, then recommend it with confidence”.

Customers are already using AI to shortlist products, compare options, and even complete purchases without hopping between ten tabs. Google is rebuilding parts of Shopping around AI, including AI-generated guidance for shoppers. Amazon has put a generative AI shopping assistant, Rufus, into the shopping journey - look for the icon on the bottom right of the Shopping app. OpenAI is pushing merchant connectivity, including Instant Checkout inside ChatGPT. Similarly, Microsoft has just announced Checkout for Copilot with fully fledged shopping features including in-app purchases

## What this means in plain English

AI tools do three things very well:

  1. Translate messy human questions into structured intent - “Best accountant for a small charity in Cardiff”, “running shoes for flat feet under £200”, “emergency plumber who can come today”.

  2. Pull together signals from lots of places - Your website; particularly product pages and pricing, reviews, business listings, photos, plus as much as possible from third-party sources eg. Truspilot for reviews.

  3. Recommend the option that looks the best and easiest to trust. Clear structured info, consistent details, strong consumer or client proof plus low friction to buy an item or book a service.




So the mission is simple. Make your business easy to understand, easy to verify, and easy to action.

## Five steps to get ready

### 1) Make your offer legible to AI

If an AI cannot confidently describe what you do and who you do it for, it will default to someone else.

Do this on your website first:

  * Create one page per core offer. Each page should answer: who it is for, what problem it solves, what is included, what it costs (or how pricing works), typical timelines, and what happens next.

  * Use straightforward wording that matches how customers ask questions. Avoid industry terms and jargon. Use the phrases customers actually type and say.

  * Add structured data where relevant. Product schema for ecommerce, LocalBusiness for local services, FAQ schema for common questions. Schema is important for product discovery.




Online retailer add-ons:

  * Keep product titles, descriptions, pricing, availability, and images consistently accurate across your site and feeds.

  * Use identifiers where you have them (GTIN, MPN) and include key attributes customers filter by.




Service business add-ons:

  * Put your service area, hours, response times, and booking options in obvious places.

  * Add a pricing guide if you can. If you cannot, explain the factors that change the price.




### 2) Build trust signals that AI can repeat

Humans trust proof. AI systems also lean heavily on proof because it is easier to justify in a recommendation.

Good quality reviews, case studies and testimonials are important for every business type.

What to do:

  * Collect reviews regularly, not in a frantic burst once a year.

  * Encourage specifics in reviews. What was bought, what problem was solved, what the outcome was.

  * Publish testimonials and case studies on your site. Short is fine, but make them concrete.

  * Make policies easy to find. Returns, refunds, delivery, guarantees, privacy, complaint handling.




Online retailers:

  * Display delivery costs, timescales, and returns clearly, ideally on product pages as well as a policy page. Trust drops fast when the “surprise” delivery or admin charge appears at checkout.




Local and professional services:

  * Show credentials, memberships, accreditations, insurance, and safeguarding where relevant.

  * Add a simple “What to expect” section so people know the process.




### 3) Be present where AI assistants pull data

Think of this as distribution, not “yet another platform”.

Key point for websites:

AI tools need to be able to access your content. OpenAI publishes guidance on its crawlers and how site owners can allow or block them via robots.txt, including OAI-SearchBot.

Practical checklist:

  * Check your robots.txt is not blocking the AI crawlers you want visibility from.

  * Make sure key pages are indexable (not hidden behind logins or heavy scripts).

  * Ensure your business information is consistent across the web. Name, address, phone number, website, opening hours




Retailer distribution:

  * Look seriously at merchant integrations. Microsoft’s Copilot Merchant Program is designed for catalogue integration and visibility. OpenAI is positioning ChatGPT for merchant connections, including Instant Checkout.




Wider small business distribution:

  * Keep your Google Business Profile accurate (services, categories, photos, updates)

  * Make sure you are listed correctly on key industry directories customers actually use.

  * Publish FAQs and service pages that answer “comparison” questions. These are the questions AI assistants love.




#### A quick reality check

Not every platform will happily share its data with every AI. For example, reporting suggests Amazon has blocked some OpenAI crawling, which limits what ChatGPT can pull directly from Amazon pages. So small businesses that keep their own sites and listings in line with the advice given here can win.

### 4) Turn customer questions into content that gets cited

AI assistants often respond by citing and summarising. Your content should be written to be summarised well.

Create a small library of “answer pages” including:

  * FAQs that reflect real wording from customers

  * “Which should I choose” comparisons

  * Use cases, case studies and buying guides

  * Troubleshooting and aftercare advice

  * Clear contact and next-step instructions




Retail examples:

  * “Which trail shoe is best for muddy paths”

  * “What size should I buy for this fit”

  * “Is this compatible with” style posts




Service examples

  * “How much does it cost to” with ranges and factors

  * “How long does it take to”

  * “What happens if” questions




Google is explicitly leaning into AI-guided shopping research experiences, so helpful guidance content is not just nice, it is part of the shopping journey now.

### 5) Track what AI-driven customers do, then tighten the loop

The final step of measurement and tracking is the difference between guessing and knowing.

What to track in tools like Google Analytics:

  * Referral traffic from AI tools. Look for parameters like utm_source=chatgpt.com.

  * Conversion rate by source.

  * Assisted conversions, especially for services where the sale happens later.

  * Customer questions that appear as search terms. These can provide great content and FAQ ideas as well as help with sales objections.




Simple testing routine:

  * Write 10 prompts your customers would ask an AI.

  * Run them in ChatGPT, Copilot, and Gemini.

  * Note who gets recommended and why.

  * Fix the gaps on your site and listings. Missing pricing, unclear service area, weak proof, confusing product data.




## What’s coming next

Two developments matter a lot for small businesses.

#### In-chat shopping

The direction of travel is that AI conversations will turn into actions, not just recommendations. As mentioned earlier OpenAI, Google and Microsoft are all pushing shopping experiences inside ChatGPT, Gemini and Copilot respectively.

More sponsored placements will shortly be displayed inside AI shopping experiences. Google is starting to integrate personalised shopping ads into AI experiences, which means “organic only” visibility may get harder over time. The sensible response is to get your foundations right now, so you are not forced into paying just to be seen.

## Quick action plan for this week

  * Audit your top 5 pages. Are they clear, current, and written in customer language?

  * Add or improve one trust asset. A case study, testimonials page, or review collection process.

  * Check crawl access. Make sure you are not blocking the bots you want visibility from.

  * Build your “AI prompt pack”. 10 prompts, three tools, one document.

  * Measure traffic from AI sources. Then decide what to fix first based on impact.




If you want help prioritising, Pollinger AI can run a practical AI readiness review and then map the work into a short, realistic plan you can actually deliver.

Book a FREE 15 minutes chat with Jonathan to learn more.

I’m throwing this one to the lions:

Business Owners: Would you actually trust a pure human strategy over an AI-optimised one right now? 

Candidates: Could you survive a 4-hour technical test if I took away your access to ChatGPT and Copilot?

If your entire value-add can be prompted, your salary is a race to the bottom. But if you can solve a problem the AI hasn't seen before, you are officially the most expensive asset in the 2026 economy.
We’re moving into a two-tier talent market: those who manage AI to do the doing, and a highly-paid elite who are hired specifically because they can think outside the training data.
